text: The white-throated needletail (Hirundapus caudacutus), also known as needle- tailed swift or spine-tailed swift, is a large swift in the genus Hirundapus. It can reach speeds of up to 170 km/h (105 mph) in flight. They build their nests in rock areas in cliffs or hollow trees. They do not like to sit on the ground and spend most of their time in the air. They feed on small, flying insects like beetles, flies, bees and moths. ==References== Category:Apodiformes Category:Birds of Asia Category:Birds of Oceania
title: White-throated needletail
